Navin Johnson.Action: Reflects on past wealth, power, and love, showing awareness of his decline.
Is found in a squalid state, half-conscious and clutching alcohol, indicating personal failure.
Maintains pride and dignity despite dire circumstances.
Nods happily with the family, applauds their music, though out of tempo and sheepish.
Gratefully receives a lovingly prepared birthday meal from the family, expresses thanks sincerely.
Receives modest, sincere gifts from family members, including a handmade wallet and a crayon drawing.
Nods happily out of tempo and is the only one to applaud after the gospel song.
Expresses genuine gratitude to his mother and family for the birthday meal and gifts.
Overwhelmed by family's generosity, sincerely thanks them with tears.

Declines an invitation to sing blues, citing it depresses him.

Bols from the table abruptly after being emotional.

Debates for a moment before throwing his bag into the truck and hopping in.

Stands in the same spot unsure and mistaken about seeing a car that turns out to be a truck.

Patiently insists on being paid every hour for his work.

Plans to decorate and arrange his living space with imagined features despite the impractical location.

Takes the envelope Harry gives him and opens it immediately when he feels minor pain, showing impulsiveness and lack of patience.

Explains the cash and credit card policy with some awareness of danger, showing cautiousness and understanding of procedures.

Casually deceives punks by rigging the car and setting a trap.
Feels excited and proud about seeing his name in print, perceiving it as a sign of success and future opportunities.

Demonstrates the device, explaining how the handle puts pressure on the frame correctly and compares it to tie-rods on a '72 Buick.
Receives an offer from Stan to develop and split profits on the gizmo, indicating some recognition of his idea's value.

Unable to recognize the danger when being targeted by the Madman at close range, putting himself in harm's way.

Watches a daring motorcycle stunt and is fascinated but does not engage or take any initiative.

Excitedly shows off his new possessions with little awareness of appropriateness (e.g., dragging scarf in mud).
Shows some naivety in misunderstanding or mishearing important details (confusing Nathan Johnson for someone else).
Accepts the key to a lavishly decorated, high-tech house designed for fun and extravagance.
Expresses awe and excitement about new home, engages warmly and playfully with Marie.
Shouts in anger when a baseball crashes through the window.
Responds kindly to Marie asking for her ball back, calls her 'Punkin', takes her hands and goes upstairs with her, engages in playful conversation.
Refuses charity, insisting others are more deserving
Quickly writes a check to help starving families after being urged
Dismisses a man's complaint about worn plane seats as petty and frivolous after just donating to starving people
Quickly writes a check to help needy families after being confronted with their situation.
Sweeps everything off his desk while spinning in his chair, showing lack of physical control or focus.
Dismisses the complaint about worn plane seats with a condescending remark and offers a superficial solution (saddle soap) instead of addressing it properly.
Repeatedly insists he understands the seriousness of poverty and claims personal experience, showing some awareness and assertiveness.
Immediately issues a $1500 check to help the man in distress without hesitation.
Responds emotionally and somewhat naively by crying at the mention of towels on plane seats.
Politely engages with Father De Cordoba and listens to his urgent request to see the film.
Makes a casual joke about grief and orders blinds to be closed, showing some sensitivity but also informality.
Asks to 'roll the ugliness' with a resigned tone, displaying a mix of humor and willingness to engage with difficult topics.
Tries to act sophisticated at a fancy restaurant, attempts to manage an embarrassing situation with snails on the plate by telling Marie not to look and asking the waiter to remove the snails.
Complains about small details (lack of bamboo umbrellas for wine) and reacts negatively to minor inconveniences, showing a lack of graceful handling of the situation.
Oblivious to the impracticality of wearing many heavy gold chains and nearly loses balance as a result.
Screams 'Check!' as he falls into an elegant dining table due to the weight of the gold, showing a lack of awareness of the disruption caused.
Dictates a heartfelt, intimate letter to his mother, expressing love and the special nature of their communication.
Responds to Marie's concerns about their lifestyle with indifferent 'Uh huh' answers, showing little engagement with her feelings.
Struggles trying to manage the weight of gold, collapses into a butter plate, but then gets up with superhuman strength and continues moving despite instability.
Screams 'Check!' as he falls into a collapsing table, indicating lack of awareness or control in a social or formal setting.
Dictates a letter to his mother in drunken voice, mixing trivial and formal elements (mentions attorneys, Harvard collection) while admitting to heavy drinking.
Responds passively and nonchalantly to Marie’s concerns about money, power, and friends with repeated 'Uh huh' and trivializes the situation by embracing negative press.
Engages in playful wordplay and jokes with Marie about being superficial.
Leads a board meeting in a casual, humorous manner, encouraging relaxation with a fake nap and sharing inventions enthusiastically.
Encourages Marie to show her knife-throwing skills and stays calm after being accidentally nailed to the wall.
Pulls the knife out himself without panic and makes a witty, upbeat toast despite the accident.
Does not correct Marie's mistaken recollection of lessons (Flamingo Guitar vs. Knife-throwing), showing limited attention to detail.
Dances enthusiastically with Marie despite being clumsy, shares playful banter with her
Modestly downplays his TV interview and fame by saying 'Aw, nobody wants to see this'
Smiles sickly at partygoers who are leaving and speaking negatively about him
Attempts to comfort Marie by assuring her they will not lose their stuff and that he will receive a fair trial
Responds calmly to the court ruling with a practical calculation rather than anger or despair
Writes small checks to many people, seemingly trying to do good, though in a disorganized and somewhat distracted manner.
Drinks while working and acts distracted, showing signs of instability but continues to persist.
Notices Marie crying and speaks warmly to her, asking why she is upset and commenting on her appearance with concern.
Encourages Marie with humor and optimism, promising to bounce back and buy her a huge diamond, showing a desire to uplift and connect.
Engages Marie in a candid discussion about their relationship and her longing for the man she fell in love with, demonstrating sincerity and openness.
Writes checks diligently, making an effort to manage his affairs.
Appears confused and distracted by lint, showing inattentiveness and possible mental disarray.
Speaks optimistically about bouncing back and achieving success again.
His pants are down around his ankles, indicating careless or distracted behavior.
Leaves Marie's home quietly, taking only a few personal items, despite being treated coldly and with hostility.
Looks indignant but does not respond with anger or aggression after Marie slams the door on him.
Walks with pants around his ankles through public places without embarrassment or hostility; accepts awkward situations with no apparent resentment.
Sits shyly in a corner, waits patiently for Stan's attention while Stan talks about a new idea.
Excitedly shares new ideas with Stan, showing enthusiasm and optimism despite Stan's preoccupation.
Waits for Stan, saying 'Wait for me,' demonstrating patience and a desire to collaborate.
Sits alone on a bench, contemplative, shows vulnerability by staring in delirium and unfolding a tattered note.
Attempts to clean a car windshield but smears oil and food over it, then holds out his hand for a tip as the car speeds away.
Speaks openly and vulnerably to the camera, sharing a personal story.
Shows affectionate and sincere behavior by kissing his parents and family members upon reunion.
Hesitates but then embraces Marie warmly and with enthusiasm.
Attempts to clean a car windshield but ends up smearing oil and food, obscuring the driver's view, then asks for a tip.
Engages warmly and emotionally with family after returning home, showing social and emotional awareness.
Picks up a thermos as a gift for Marie, expresses love sincerely.
Acknowledges his dirtiness humorously but still shares affection.
Reminisces fondly about family time singing and dancing together.
